column2: 4. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
5. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: once you see the toll booth.
column6: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column8: when you first see the exit sign.
column10: before moving into the exit lane.

column2: 6. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column6: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 7. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column6: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column8: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.

column4: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.
column6: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column4: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.

column2: 23. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
24. When driving in fog, drivers should use:

column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 26. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column6: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column8: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column10: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.

column2: 27. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column6: follow the vehicle ahead of you.
column8: stop, look right, then left, then right again.
column10: stop, look left, then right, then left again.

column2: 28. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column6: number of cars in front of you.
column8: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.

column6: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 30. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
